evidence: Detected note-style list structure (1 bullets, 0 numbered items)

data.content:
LIBERTY AND CHURCH (ALTERNATE TITLE: OVERJOY)

          "PILOT - INTO THE FIRE"

    INSIPRED BY REAL PEOPLE, REAL EVENTS

                        TEASER
A BLACK SCREEN—
Sounds of a man and woman arguing in Puerto Rican
Spanish are peppered with those of tumbling furniture
and shattering glass.
FADE IN

INT. DINGY MOTEL ROOM - LATE DAY
A SMALL FIGURE quickly scampers to a CHAIR in a corner
of the room. We continue to hear yelling and things
being thrown around the room.
The light from the setting sun is coming through the
MOTEL room WINDOW and hits the face of the small
figure. We see YOUNG DANTE with dark hair and big
brown, frightened eyes.
SMACK--

The little girl sees DANTE’S MOTHER (30s, Latina,
fragile yet tough) head hit the floor in front of her.
Her mother is lying on her side with her eyes wide
open and looking up at the little girl. A trickle of
blood starts trailing down her jawline from her ear.
Her eyes are scared yet attempting reassurance.
The little girl appears frozen in a trance as she looks
down on her mother.

                  YOUNG DANTE
          Uno... Dos... Tres...
The sun illuminates behind DANTE’S FATHER (30s,
Haitian, large and scary) as his shadowy figure looks
up to the little girl. He puts a finger to his lips
and walks out.
CUT TO BLACK
--we hear the little girl’s voice morph into the voice
of a woman counting in a whisper in her head.

                                                       2.



                   DANTE (V.O., CONT’D)
           ... Quatro... Cinco... Seis...
FADE IN:

INT. BEL INC. OFFICE, WINTER, 1997 - JUST BEFORE DAWN
We see a man’s lower jaw and mouth moving while talking.
The counting appears to be for the man’s teeth.
                     DANTE (V.O., CONT’D)
           ... Siete... Ocho... Nueve...
We are looking at the patterns of a woman’s dress.
Then, to a woman’s mouth moving. No sound, until...
                     CASSANDRA
            ... Dante?
CASSANDRA (late-30s woman, well-put together and
stern). She has a borderline English accent, but
she was born and raised here, in Manhattan.
                        DANTE (V.O.)
           Yes. Ummm…
                     JOAQUIN
           You havin’ a seizure? You
           wanna borrow Cassandra’s ball
           gag so you don’t swallow your
           tongue?
JOAQUIN is a chubby, short, half-bald with a burnt
hair comb-over male in his 50s). His mother is a
Newfoundlander, and he often uses the accent when
cracking jokes, which is most of the time.
A third set of eyes is looking at the woman. This is
ABE, a chronically tired, highly manicured ’silver
fox’ in his 50s.
They are all affluently dressed and in 3 expensive leather
office chairs.
Across from these 3 figures is DANTE (mid-late 20s
stunning woman with milk chocolate skin).

                                                    3.



The room is slightly dark in these last moments before
dawn. There is nothing else in the room but a window and
a FIERY PAINTING worth more than most people’s homes,
behind the interviewers.
Without breaking his eye-contact with Dante, Abe raises
one ’enough’ finger to Joaquin.
                    ABE
          I will repeat the question
          this once. If you ran over
          someone on your way to work,
          would you stop, or would you
          keep going?
                    DANTE
          I would keep going.
                    JOAQUIN
          You got human fucking blood
          all over your grill. You keep
          going?
                    DANTE
          No. I would stop first. I
          would see how they are.
Dante’s eyes dart frantically to all the interviewers.
                    ABE
          And if stopping would cause
          you to miss the market
          opening in London...?
                    JOAQUIN
          You just whammed someone, and
          you’re shitfaced. You think
          it’s wise to stop?
                    DANTE
          Well, no, not if I was going
          to be late. I would keep
          going if I was going to be
          late...
               (beat; confused)
          I’m on my way to work?
                     JOAQUIN
          Exactly.
Joaquin sits back. All is quiet and all 3 are staring
at Dante.

                                                    4.


                  CASSANDRA
          Dante. Honey. Why exactly do
          you want to work for BEL? Be
          honest.
A beat between Cassandra and Dante. Dante takes a
large breath and refocuses. Somewhat practiced…

                  DANTE
          Because I want to be rich. I
          want to be powerful.
               (beat)
          Because I want to be somebody
          that nobody can fuck with.
Silence. The 3 interviewers are staring at her.
Cassandra and Joaquin smile. Abe remains stone-faced.
The sun begins to rise, and the dawn light pours
in, illuminating Dante’s face.
                  END OF TEASER

                                                      5.


                        ACT ONE

INT. BEL INC. EMPTY WASHROOM - EARLY MORNING

Marble everything. Gold fixtures gleam under soft lighting.
As we FADE IN, we hear excited squealing.
                    DANTE (into phone)
            I got it!

  She is speaking excitedly in non-sequiturs.

               DANTE (CONT’D)
            I only have a minute ’cause
            I’m about to have a tour
            around my new office. Ahh!
            I’ve never been so happy!
            Carajo... what a grueling
            process. This one was nothing
            like the other two. It was
            just... weird. I... I can’t
            believe I got it after
            that... I just need these
            next two years... Ah! I’m
            calling you on my new
            CELLPHONE!
  Dante is awkwardly holding a brand-new giant MOTOROLA.
  She is smiling and brimming over with joy.


               DANTE (CONT’D)
                 (into phone)
            Yah, I tried to do what you
            said, but I was so
            nervous... I just blanked--
                 (beat)
            You know, it seemed like
            Cassandra had the final say.
            She’s the one who pulled me
            aside after the interview to
            tell me I was hired --
  Dante is listening intently.
               DANTE (CONT’D)
                 (into phone)
            -- oh yah, Abe. Yah, I
            finally met him.
                 (laughs and whispers)
            He is a pencil-necked prick--

                                                    6.


Dante’s sentence is interrupted by a woman walking into
the bathroom. It is LAYNAH, a 30-something broad-
shouldered, fake-breasted broker dressed in high-end
country club wear.

                    DANTE
         Hi
Laynah looks her up and down and shoots her a murderous
glare while heading to a stall.
She turns her back and covers the phone receiver with
her hand. She resumes listening.

                  DANTE
               (whispering into phone)
          I don’t know.
          (beat)
          In the office bathroom.
          (beat)
Dante looks up to a small mirror mounted in the top corner
of the bathroom. (*Note: We won’t know this until later,
but this is a camera that Abe and Joaquin watch
regularly.)
                     DANTE
                  (whispers)
          Fuck.

She hears a muffled sniff coming from the stall at the
same time the toilet flushes.

Dante turns to the mirror and looks at herself in full.
Over it, PRELAP:

                  LAYNAH (V.O.)
          Who the HELL is that
          Dominican street trash?

INT. ABE’S OFFICE - MORNING
We see Laynah, jaw grinding and enraged.
Abe is at his desk reading documents and listening to a
constant stream of news radio through an EAR BUD. He
doesn’t look up.

                                                       7.


Adorning the wall behind him is a giant PAINTING of a
storming ocean. His desk is sprawling and elegant with
DOCUMENTS and NEWSPAPERS neatly stacked in various
piles. We see his PAGER and BEEPER side by side at the
corner of the desk. The office is stunning, pristine,
and nothing short of regal.
                   LAYNAH (CONT’D)
          I thought we had a freeze on
          hiring more women. Something
          about ’bleeding, cramps and
          no more mat leave’?
Abe’s phone starts to ring. It is at his ear before the
ring ends.

                    GRETA (V.O.)
          Dunaway needs your help with
          Mr. Daniels, sir.
Abe knows exactly what this means. Without looking at
her, he puts his finger up to Laynah, and points to
the small, leather LOVE SEAT at the back of the room.
                    ABE
               (into phone)
          Count to 30 and connect me.
Abe cradles the phone and presses ’hold’.
We see Laynah sit down in a huff, drumming her false
nails on the fine leather.
Abe jumps up and runs to the corner of his office
where we see a PUNCHING BAG. He intensely pounds off
a few rounds.
On his way back, he turns the STEREO on and cranks
the volume. It is the frenzied sound of brokers. He
goes to the phone and answers completely out of
breath with voice racing. He starts pacing.
                   ABE (CONT’D)
            (panting into phone)
           Steven! Steve...
Abe is listening impatiently. STEVEN DANIELS is a
long-time client of Abe’s. Always second-guessing and
backing out of deals, he needs a LOT of reassurance.
Abe knows exactly how to play him.

                                                        8.


                    ABE (CONT’D)
               (yelling into phone)
          Yes. Yes. I understand. You
          need to calm down Steve.
          Listen, the London numbers are
          out, and the market is
          tanking. The employment
          numbers came out (panting)…
          they are weak, and they are
          low. Now prices are getting
          jacked up because the storm
          and power outages have been
          pooling energy over. EVERYONE
          is shorting their stock. All
          my brokers are here early to
          clean this fucking mess up.
          We need to get everyone’s
          tickets in the second the
          market opens.
               (holds phone to stereo)
We hear the frantic, muffled voice of Steven Daniels on
the other line. Abe brings the phone back to his ear.
We notice a practiced cadence to Abe’s speech.
                    ABE (CONT’D)
               (into phone)
          Steve, the longer you hold on
          to the position the worse it
          will be. Hold on. Let me go
          to my desk and get out of
          this frenzy.
                (slowly turns down volume)
          Listen. You either get rid of
          those shares now, or they
          will be as worthless as a used
          fucking condom. Are you
          listening to me? No one will
          want to buy them. Do you
          enjoy high quality toilet
          paper, Daniels? Do you? Tell
          me. Because if you do, these
          shares are about to become
          the most expensive shit
          tickets you have ever owned.
          Hell, if you like them so
          much, we can get you more and
          give your ass      the   royal
          treatment it deserves!
Laynah muffles a laugh. Abe’s eyes flicker up to her.
She quickly wipes the smile off her face. We hear
Daniels’ muffled rambling again.

                                                    9.


Abe sits back down at his desk and reaches for a
BLANK TICKET while listening.
             ABE (CONT’D)
               (into phone)
          Steven, you sound like you
          need some relax time. Listen,

YOUNG DANTE
Uno... Dos... Tres...
The sun illuminates behind DANTE'S FATHER (30s, Haitian, large and scary) as his shadowy figure looks up to the little girl. He puts a finger to his lips and walks out.
CUT TO BLACK
--we hear the little girl's voice morph into the voice of a woman counting in a whisper in her head.
DANTE (V.O., CONT'D)
... Quatro... Cinco... Seis...
FADE IN:

elements.content: INT. BEL INC. OFFICE, WINTER, 1997 - JUST BEFORE DAWN
We see a man's lower jaw and mouth moving while talking.
The counting appears to be for the man's teeth.
DANTE (V.O., CONT'D)
... Siete... Ocho... Nueve...
We are looking at the patterns of a woman's dress.
Then, to a woman's mouth moving. No sound, until...
CASSANDRA
... Dante?
CASSANDRA (late-30s woman, well-put together and stern). She has a borderline English accent, but she was born and raised here, in Manhattan.
DANTE (V.O.)
Yes. Ummm...
JOAQUIN
You havin' a seizure? You wanna borrow Cassandra's ball gag so you don't swallow your tongue?
JOAQUIN is a chubby, short, half-bald with a burnt hair comb-over male in his 50s). His mother is a Newfoundlander, and he often uses the accent when cracking jokes, which is most of the time.
A third set of eyes is looking at the woman. This is ABE, a chronically tired, highly manicured 'silver fox' in his 50s.
They are all affluently dressed and in 3 expensive leather office chairs.
Across from these 3 figures is DANTE (mid-late 20s stunning woman with milk chocolate skin).
The room is slightly dark in these last moments before dawn. There is nothing else in the room but a window and a FIERY PAINTING worth more than most people's homes, behind the interviewers.
Without breaking his eye-contact with Dante, Abe raises one 'enough' finger to Joaquin.
ABE
I will repeat the question this once. If you ran over someone on your way to work, would you stop, or would you keep going?
DANTE
I would keep going.
JOAQUIN
You got human fucking blood all over your grill. You keep going?
DANTE
No. I would stop first. I would see how they are.
Dante's eyes dart frantically to all the interviewers.
ABE
And if stopping would cause you to miss the market opening in London...?
JOAQUIN
You just whammed someone, and you're shitfaced. You think it's wise to stop?
DANTE
Well, no, not if I was going to be late. I would keep going if I was going to be late...
(beat; confused)
I'm on my way to work?
JOAQUIN
Exactly.
Joaquin sits back. All is quiet and all 3 are staring at Dante.
CASSANDRA
Dante. Honey. Why exactly do you want to work for BEL? Be honest.
A beat between Cassandra and Dante. Dante takes a large breath and refocuses. Somewhat practiced...
DANTE
Because I want to be rich. I want to be powerful.
(beat)
Because I want to be somebody that nobody can fuck with.
Silence. The 3 interviewers are staring at her. Cassandra and Joaquin smile. Abe remains stone-faced.
The sun begins to rise, and the dawn light pours in, illuminating Dante's face.
END OF TEASER
ACT ONE

elements.content: INT. BEL INC. EMPTY WASHROOM - EARLY MORNING
Marble everything. Gold fixtures gleam under soft lighting.
As we FADE IN, we hear excited squealing.
DANTE (INTO PHONE)
I got it!
She is speaking excitedly in non-sequiturs.
DANTE (CONT'D)
I only have a minute 'cause
I'm about to have a tour
around my new office. Ahh!
I've never been so happy!
CARAJO... WHAT A GRUELING
process. This one was nothing
like the other two. It was
just... weird. I... I can't
believe I got it after
that... I just need these
next two years... Ah! I'm
calling you on my new
CELLPHONE!
Dante is awkwardly holding a brand-new giant MOTOROLA.
She is smiling and brimming over with joy.
DANTE (CONT'D)
(into phone)
Yah, I tried to do what you
said, but I was so
NERVOUS... I JUST BLANKED--
(beat)
You know, it seemed like
Cassandra had the final say.
She's the one who pulled me
aside after the interview to
tell me I was hired --
Dante is listening intently.
DANTE (CONT'D)
(into phone)
-- oh yah, Abe. Yah, I
FINALLY MET HIM.
(laughs and whispers)
He is a pencil-necked prick--
Dante's sentence is interrupted by a woman walking into
the bathroom. It is LAYNAH, a 30-something broad-
shouldered, fake-breasted broker dressed in high-end
country club wear.
DANTE
Hi
Laynah looks her up and down and shoots her a murderous
glare while heading to a stall.
She turns her back and covers the phone receiver with
her hand. She resumes listening.
DANTE (CONT'D)
(whispering into phone)
I DON'T KNOW.
(beat)
IN THE OFFICE BATHROOM.
(beat)
Dante looks up to a small mirror mounted in the top corner
of the bathroom. (*Note: We won't know this until later,
but this is a camera that Abe and Joaquin watch
regularly.)
DANTE (CONT'D)
(whispers)
Fuck.
She hears a muffled sniff coming from the stall at the
same time the toilet flushes.
Dante turns to the mirror and looks at herself in full.
Over it, PRELAP:
LAYNAH (V.O.)
Who the HELL is that
Dominican street trash?

elements.content: INT. ABE'S OFFICE - MORNING
We see Laynah, jaw grinding and enraged.
Abe is at his desk reading documents and listening to a constant stream of news radio through an EAR BUD. He doesn't look up.

Adorning the wall behind him is a giant PAINTING of a storming ocean. His desk is sprawling and elegant with DOCUMENTS and NEWSPAPERS neatly stacked in various piles. We see his PAGER and BEEPER side by side at the corner of the desk. The office is stunning, pristine, and nothing short of regal.
LAYNAH (CONT'D)
I thought we had a freeze on hiring more women. Something about 'bleeding, cramps and no more mat leave'?
Abe's phone starts to ring. It is at his ear before the ring ends.
GRETA (V.O.)
Dunaway needs your help with Mr. Daniels, sir.
Abe knows exactly what this means. Without looking at her, he puts his finger up to Laynah, and points to the small, leather LOVE SEAT at the back of the room.
ABE
(into phone)
Count to 30 and connect me.
Abe cradles the phone and presses 'hold'.
We see Laynah sit down in a huff, drumming her false nails on the fine leather.
Abe jumps up and runs to the corner of his office where we see a PUNCHING BAG. He intensely pounds off a few rounds.
On his way back, he turns the STEREO on and cranks the volume. It is the frenzied sound of brokers. He goes to the phone and answers completely out of breath with voice racing. He starts pacing.
ABE (CONT'D)
(panting into phone)
Steven! Steve...
Abe is listening impatiently. STEVEN DANIELS is a long-time client of Abe's. Always second-guessing and backing out of deals, he needs a LOT of reassurance. Abe knows exactly how to play him.
ABE (CONT'D)
(yelling into phone)

Yes. Yes. I understand. You need to calm down Steve. Listen, the London numbers are out, and the market is tanking. The employment numbers came out (panting)... they are weak, and they are low. Now prices are getting jacked up because the storm and power outages have been pooling energy over. EVERYONE is shorting their stock. All my brokers are here early to clean this fucking mess up. We need to get everyone's tickets in the second the market opens.
(holds phone to stereo)
We hear the frantic, muffled voice of Steven Daniels on the other line. Abe brings the phone back to his ear. We notice a practiced cadence to Abe's speech.
ABE (CONT'D)
(into phone)
Steve, the longer you hold on to the position the worse it will be. Hold on. Let me go to my desk and get out of this frenzy.
(slowly turns down volume)

Listen. You either get rid of those shares now, or they will be as worthless as a used fucking condom. Are you listening to me? No one will want to buy them. Do you enjoy high quality toilet paper, Daniels? Do you? Tell me. Because if you do, these shares are about to become the most expensive shit tickets you have ever owned. Hell, if you like them so much, we can get you more and give your ass the royal treatment it deserves!
Laynah muffles a laugh. Abe's eyes flicker up to her. She quickly wipes the smile off her face. We hear Daniels' muffled rambling again.
Abe sits back down at his desk and reaches for a BLANK TICKET while listening.
ABE (CONT'D)
(into phone)
Steven, you sound like you need some relax time. Listen, I'll dump your shares, and then we'll all go out for a nice night on the town tomorrow to celebrate. We'll end up at Flashdancers--
He looks back up to Laynah.
ABE (CONT'D)
(into phone)
-- in fact, why don't I have one of my girls pick you up an hour before...
Laynah is pleading 'no' with her eyes. He doesn't react to her.
ABE (CONT'D)
(into phone)
... to help you wind down.
(beat)
Excellent. Done deal. 7pm, tomorrow. We'll start at I'Tremeli. I'll have our people let the banks know the second the market opens. You made the right call Steven. See you then.
As Abe hangs up, he starts writing the ticket. A painfully long silence occurs in the room.
ABE
First, although it is none of your business, she is not hired. When have we ever hired at the 3rd interview?
LAYNAH
We haven't --
ABE
-- Yes. We haven't. Ever. Lastly, 6pm tomorrow, be at Steven Daniels' house. Look slutty --
(MORE)
ABE (CONT'D)
(looks up and re-considers)
-- ER.
And don't wear one of your JAP-y Bar Mitzvah dresses.
Laynah gets up to leave.
ABE (CONT'D)
Oh, and tell Greta to make the reso. And take this ticket to Crooked Tits.
As Abe is giving Laynah the ticket, we see, through the slightly ajar door, the back of Dante and a very curvy blonde woman stopped in front.
Dante turns and looks at Abe. There is a beat between them. Abe looks back down to his business at hand.

elements.content: INT. 3RD FLOOR CORRIDOR - MORNING - CONTINUOUS

GRETA (GREATNESS), 40s, the office manager (but more like office mother), and her sweet perma-smile, are touring Dante around the building. She has a wholesome beauty about her. In her sing-song voice:
GRETA
(pointing to the bottom floor)
Now, Abe has 2 offices--
BAM! Laynah collides with Dante's back.
DANTE
Oops! Sorry...
As Dante turns, her and Laynah have a beat between them.
GRETA
Oh, wonderful timing! I was just touring around our newest broker-in-training, Dante...
(looking to Dante)
De La Cruz?
(Dante nods)
This is Laynah. She is a wonderfully motivated and--
Laynah's scowl has turned into a large, fake and tight smile. She postures for Dante. Her voice is irritating.
LAYNAH
(overlapping her)
--we met in the washroom. Didn't we? You were talking on the phone.
(tight smile)
Well, I'm very busy.
(holding up the ticket)
Welcome to the family... Dante.
Laynah turns on her heel and leaves.
DANTE
Thank you. Nice to meet--
LAYNAH
(overlapping)
--oh, and Greta...
(Laynah turns back)
... Abe wants to take me out for dinner tomorrow night, with Mr. Daniels, to thank me for helping save his account. Make reservations for 3 at I'Tremeli. 7pm.
Laynah quickly rushes off.
Greta smiles sweetly at Dante and puts her arm in hers.
GRETA
Well, Cassandra has requested that I set you up in your new home before the market opens, so, let's get this tour going, shall we?
Dante looks back at Abe. His back is now turned to her, and he is on the phone.
GRETA (CONT'D)
Speaking of whom, guess who is next?
Greta ushers her forward. Cassandra is on the phone.
GRETA (CONT'D)
Oopsie! It's best not to disturb her right now.

They walk past an art-deco white DESK with fine lines. The area is impeccably clean and minimalistic. Any office necessity that you do see is made of clean steel, glass, or is white. Even the TELEVISION is beautiful.
Cassandra is at this desk, on her COMPUTER, on her PHONE, watching the morning news, checking her PAGER and half-watching the transaction that just occurred.
CASSANDRA
(firmly into the phone)
I said, I will handle it. This one is mine. Trust me.
We hear Abe in the adjacent office hanging up his phone a moment before Cassandra.
Prelap:
We hear loud whirring and the sound of dial up internet.

elements.content: INT. CORRIDOR IN FRONT OF I.T. DESKS - MORNING
Greta and Dante are standing in front of 2 incredibly messy desks in a room full of half-repaired COMPUTERS, SYSTEM UNITS, PRINTERS, SCREENS, CORDS, WIRES -- I.T. heaven.
GRETA
Here we have some of our hardest workers. Our I.T. gentleman are here from dusk 'til dawn. If you have any technical questions, these are the brilliant minds to ask.
She raises her voice towards the men.
GRETA (CONT'D)
Gentleman, this is Dante.
Dante nods in hello at what appears to be the stocky guy (JOHN) and the lanky guy (TENNESSEE). Both look like they haven't seen the light of day for years.

Tennessee looks up from one of the desks quickly and skittishly looks away while typing. John looks up from his desk, lingers, and winks. He has 4 opened SAUCES in front of him and is eating an EGG MCMUFFIN. The sauce is all over his chin and shirt.
Greta beams at them.
GRETA (CONT'D)
THAT IS TENNESSEE...
... and John.
DANTE
Nice to meet you both.
JOHN
(lewdly sucking the sauce off his Mc Muffin)
HI DANTE. THOR.
(motions to himself)
As they continue around the square of the corridor, Dante looks down towards the center of the office.

This is the pit. It is where all the brokers and board people work. It is full of TV SCREENS, PHONES, and large PC COMPUTERS appended on top of large pillars. The massive CLOCK in the middle of the room has NYC written on top and reads 8:30am. The office has been relatively quiet up until now, save for a few brokers reading the Wall Street Journal quietly at their desks, as other employees start to file in for the day.
Greta starts quickly pointing out who is who to Dante.
GRETA
Ah, here come some of the brokers. That is Dunaway, Mike, Paul... another Mike...

MIKE THE SHIT, (tall, 30-something broker with a temper), and PAUL 'BIG WILLIE', (humpty-dumpty man in his 50s), are snorting laughing. They seem drunk. They look up to see the two ladies. Mike bends Paul over the desk and pretends to butt fuck him. They switch and Paul pretends to butt fuck Mike. When they are finished, they start stretching as though just waking up.
MIKE THE SHIT
(loudly)
Ahhhh... thanks buddy. Ready for the day.
They high five each other and head to their desks, acting like it is just normal routine.
GRETA
(laughing)
Those two are such hams! Don't pay any mind to them Dante, they just love to make us laugh. You'll be sitting just above Mike actually.
There is more filing in, but Greta keeps walking towards the stairway to the trading pit.
Dante is visibly nervous. Greta softly, yet firmly, puts a hand on Dante's arm.
GRETA (CONT'D)
Yes... you'll be starting out right down there.
(pointing to the floor just above Mike, who is now downing a bottle of PEPTO BISMAL)
Dunaway will help you get started for the first month or so and --
Cassandra walks up and interrupts Greta's tour.
CASSANDRA
-- Pardon me for interrupting Greta. May I steal Dante away?
Greta is always accommodating.
GRETA
Of course, Cassandra. We can finish our tour later.
(turning to Dante and taking her hands)
You come and see me if you need anything. Ok? I mean that. Anything at all, I am here for you.
Greta gives Dante a huge hug and hands her coat back to her.
DANTE
Thank you, Greta. You are so kind.
Greta nods and then walks down the stairs towards the pit. A few of the guys yell out "GREATNESSSSSS!". She is smiling at them and saying her good mornings.
CASSANDRA
I thought that maybe you and I could get a little breakfast. Are you peckish?
DANTE
Yes, I am.
(beat)
Is it ok... for me to just go?
CASSANDRA
Everything is always okay when you are with me. Besides, the market is going to be dead for a while. Did you get your office phone?
Dante digs in her cheap PURSE and presents her new Motorola phone that Greta gave her earlier. We note Cassandra looking at her purse with disgust.
They smile at each other.
CASSANDRA
Wonderful. Be sure to have it on you at all times. We can head out this way.
They head to the top floor and toward the elevator.
CASSANDRA (CONT'D)
(yelling to the board person just arriving)
Make sure you page any calls from Cane straight to my cell phone. No ifs, ands, or buts.
(beat)
And keep that JAP bitch off my clients!
Cassandra places a KEY in a brass wall panel of the elevator and turns it. The elevator 'dings' with the same sound as a cash register.
CASSANDRA (CONT'D)
(slightly embarrassed)
Joaquin.
The elevator doors open and it is stunning and ornate. The music is Baroque opera. Other than mirrors on all walls, it resembles the Sistine Chapel. Dante's face reflects her awe.
Cassandra has a small look of satisfaction on her face as she presses 'G'. We see on the panel that one of the floors has KEY ACCESS only.
We hear the 'cash register ding' again as we watch the thick, embossed brass elevator doors close.

elements.content: INT. GEMINI'S BAR - 8:35AM - CONTINUOUS
The doors open into a quiet, empty and low-lit bar. It
is full of deep mahogany wood and plush, red leather
BOOTHS. We see that the front door is closed, and the
window shades are drawn. It is clearly before opening
hours, yet a lone bartender looks up in greeting.
EMMA, (plain woman in her 20s), smiles at them and
immediately grabs a REMOTE CONTROL to turn on the
music (hyper-beat French Techno), and all the TVs. The
TVs are all set to various news channels. She takes
everything down to a low volume. Emma does anything
the brokers tell her to as they take care of her very
well.
They take a seat at the wood, and the Emma is over
immediately. Cassandra places her pager and beeper
beside her hand and checks it periodically when Dante
is speaking.
CASSANDRA
(to Dante)
Would you like a juice?
(to Emma)
TWO BREAKFAST JUICES EMMA.
(to Dante)
I apologize for how stressful those interviews can be. It's
nice to be able to talk with you in a more relaxed
atmosphere. How are you feeling thus far?
DANTE
Good. Very good.
CASSANDRA
You look petrified Dante. Don't lie to me. Are you scared?
DANTE
No, no. I'm very excited.
Their 'breakfast juices' arrive and Cassandra
immediately takes out a perfectly folded, CLOTH
NAPKIN from her purse, wipes the rim, and shoots hers
back. Dante is watching and follows suit almost
spitting it out as is it basically orange-tinted
pure alcohol.
DANTE (CONT'D)
(small choke)
I am very grateful to be working for this company. It
was really nice of you to vouch --
While gazing at Dante, Cassandra takes 2 fingers and
taps the bar, much akin to "hit me" in '21'.
CASSANDRA
(over)
--listen, Dante. You should be scared if your plan is to
make it alone. You had but a glimpse of the boy's club up
there. It is ferocious and chauvinistic to the extreme.
Those men are skin hungry pigs.
(beat while looking at Dante)
I am going to help you.
The next 2 breakfast juices arrive. Cassandra wipes the
rim again and shoots her drink. Dante follows suit. She
is eying Dante up and down.
CASSANDRA (CONT'D)
First off, throw out that ridiculous perfume you are
wearing. It's fake, déclassé, and it stunk up the entire
office. Even the stench of Laynah's twat rot can't
(MORE)
CASSANDRA (CONT'D)
overpower that crap. Second, you need new hair. Right now,
it looks like a nest with a rat's tail sewn into it.
Your make-up... did Tammy Faye Bakker come out with a new
J.C. Penny line? Do me a favor and don't show up in
your fucking Mexican prom dress tomorrow. And we need
to work on your poker face ...
Do you need to fart?
Dante strained smile appears stuck in position.
CASSANDRA (CONT'D)
Now, I have been looking for a strong, intelligent,
attractive woman to join forces with...
Cassandra looks Dante up and down. She taps the bar
again with 2 fingers with her eyes steady on Dante,
assessing.
CASSANDRA (CONT'D)
... and this company is suffering from great
DEFICIENCIES IN THAT DEPARTMENT.
(beat)
But I think you are moldable.
Dante looks scared and uneasy. Cassandra is watching the
bartender approach.
CASSANDRA (CONT'D)
I need you to cut this scared little girl shit and pull it
TOGETHER.
(beat)
You were hired because I have a good feeling about you,
Dante. I need you to trust me and do what I say. Always. Do
exactly what I say.
Two more breakfast juices arrive. Cassandra taps the
bar again with 2 fingers and makes a 'cut off' line
with her index finger.
DANTE
Should we get some menus?
The bartender laughs quietly to herself and walks
away. Cassandra wipes the rim, shoots her drink, as
does Dante again. Cassandra maintains her composure as
though she's had nothing to drink. Dante is already
beginning to show her state.
CASSANDRA
Food contaminates the mind. Now... I have a friend on 5th
Avenue who can get you started. Let's consider this a
welcome gift. From me to you.
Dante has no idea what she is talking about. Two more
drinks arrive. The bartender walks off. Cassandra wipes
the rim and turns to Dante. She holds up her drink with
a smile.
CASSANDRA (CONT'D)
Your face Dante, relax your face. To the start of a
stinking rich partnership.
Before Dante can respond, Cassandra has shot her
drink, stood up and is turning to leave.
Dante drinks and watches Cassandra walking away.
Cassandra turns and slaps the top of her hip once.
With that, Dante scrambles up from her seat and
heads towards Cassandra.
The somewhat blurry Emma is helping a couple of new
arrivals that she recognizes from the trading floor.
Emma looks up, smiles and waves, and starts making her
way around the bar. She gestures to encourage Dante to
leave with Cassandra quickly. Dante smiles and turns
to exit.
THUD! The door shuts in her face.

elements.content: EXT. SAK'S FIFTH AVE FRONT ENTRANCE - CONTINUOUS
The Saks Fifth Avenue sales manager smiling in greeting.

LILIANE, (slight, 60-something, exquisitely coiffed female), is from the pre-plastic surgery generation and wears her age gracefully. She is gracious, kind and accommodating to her rich clients. She looks Dante up and down and smiles quaintly.
LILIANE
I trust this visit is for
your new friend, Cassandra?
Cassandra smiles. Liliane unlocks and opens the door.
LILIANE (CONT'D)
After you, ladies.
Cassandra slips in quickly. As Dante walks in, she attempts to cover her awe. Liliane locks the door again behind them.
CASSANDRA
Liliane, this is Dante. Dante
is a new broker at the firm.
PLEASE HAVE HER APPEARANCE
reflect this.
Cassandra passes Liliane her BLACK VISA CARD. Dante looks from Cassandra to Liliane with bewilderment.
LILIANE
Of course, Ms. Constantine.
It will be my absolute
pleasure.
While dialing the phone, Cassandra pauses to look up at Dante.
CASSANDRA
Have fun.

Liliane takes Dante's arm in hers and leads her down the hall. They stop at a wall near the front entrance and Liliane opens a steel box with a key from her GIANT KEY RING. She flicks on the light switches inside. The entire store illuminates further and they enter the adjacent elevator.
Much like the shopping scenes in Pretty Women, there are various montages of Liliane dressing Cassandra in beautiful CLOTHING, SHOES, MAKE-UP, and even attempts to re-style Dante's hair.
Cassandra is there, on the phone the entire time, approving or disapproving everything. All that she approves would be considered incredibly provocative.
Dante comes out with her final make-over and truly looks like a high-end prostitute.
CASSANDRA
CLIENT ENTERTAINING OUTFIT.
MEMORIZE THIS.
(into phone)
Fucktard, I told you to not
let that JAP bitch talk to
Cane.
Dante comes out with a provocative yet conservative outfit.
CASSANDRA (CONT'D)
OFFICE-WEAR. YOU CAN KEEP
THAT ONE ON.
(somewhat to herself)
JOAQUIN WILL APPRECIATE THIS
ONE.
(into phone)
No, not you. Listen, I am
going to rip your eyes out and
shove them up your ass when I
get there.
Cassandra looks to Liliane and gives her the 'bill please' symbol with her index and thumb. Liliane nods and completes the sale. Cassandra signs while on the phone.
Dante is standing in the mirror, flushed with excitement. She has never worn clothes this expensive before.
Liliane comes around the counter to show them out. Dante puts on her new, FAUX FUR-COLLARED TRENCH COAT. Liliane unlocks the door and opens it.
LILIANE
It was lovely to meet you,
Dante. Any friend of Ms.
Constantine is a friend of
ours. Please come see us for
anything you need.
Liliane shakes Dante's hand with both her hands. She has pressed her personal business card into Dante's hand. Dante takes a quick look at the card and smiles.
Cassandra reaches out and closes Dante's hand again. She gives her a look as though to say, don't be tacky.

Cassandra suddenly looks a bit flushed and seems to have become a bit flustered. She almost looks soft. As though she notices, her face suddenly hardens again, she releases Dante's hand and quickens the exit.
CASSANDRA
Thank you, Liliane. You are a
gem. Now, I have an
appointment with a client,
so I must be off.
Cassandra turns around and leaves.
DANTE
Thank you, Ms. Liliane. I
really appreciate your help.
LILIANE
They will be delivered to
your office today. Would you
LIKE YOUR ORIGINAL CLOTHING
delivered as well?
Dante takes a moment to consider.
DANTE
No, thank you Liliane. You can
burn those.
Liliane smiles graciously and lets her out the front door. As Dante leaves, we see her look back. Liliane is still standing at the door smiling and nodding in goodbye. Dante smiles warmly back.

Dante turns and we see that she is surrounded by a sea
of swarming taxis. The streets are steamy as the sun
is now beaming brightly down on this glorious winter
day in NYC. Dante takes a deep breath and smiles.
As she scans the bustling city scene for Cassandra, we

Cassandra sees her and lowers her window. She has her

One more thing Dante... don't
you dare puke tonight. I've spent
a lot of fucking money on you.

YOU LOOK GOOD.

Oh, and Dante... don't ask,
DON'T TELL.

You should get back to work.
Cassandra tells the cab driver where to go while
simultaneously answering her ringing phone and putting

respond.
Cassandra's cab whizzes off leaving Dante
stranded, confused, yet strangely empowered.
After a beat, she starts to hail a cab.

elements.content: INT. BEL INC. OFFICE - 11:30AM
DING! The elevator doors open and we see Dante struggling
to walk in her new HIGH HEELS.
Dante looks around. She has never seen anything like
it in her life. There are well over 30 brokers
speaking on their phones simultaneously. Some are
shouting at computer screens, some at TV screens,
some at each other.
They are wading in a sea of white, crumpled, tiny
PAPER droppings.
She appears frozen in her tracks, as she has no idea
what to do or where to go.
Greta sees her coming and goes straight to her.
GRETA
Ah! You look absolutely stunning. It is so wonderful to
have another female around here, and a beautiful one at
that.
DANTE
Thank you, Greta. I hope I
wasn't gone too long. I
couldn't seem to hail a
cab...
GRETA
I wouldn't worry about that.
You still don't know how
things work around here.
Greta gives Dante a little wink.
GRETA (CONT'D)
Well, shall we continue our
tour? Show off this beautiful
outfit!
DANTE
Yes... I, uh, did a little
shopping...
GRETA
Wise choice, love. Well, we
might as well start with my
office.
Greta starts to walk down the hall, beckoning Dante to
join her.
They head up the stairs to the 3rd level towards a
desk facing the pit.

elements.content: INT. BEL INC. - GRETA'S DESK - MORNING
Greta's desk is beautiful. Her area is decorated in
mostly yellow. It is very cozy and somehow feels like
a country home. As soon as Dante enters, Greta,
seemingly psychic, has already poured her a giant
GLASS of water and hands her a TYLENOL. She picks up
a box of BAND-AIDS and removes two.
GRETA
Self-care is key. Always take
care of yourself first.
Greta looks at her intently. Dante nods and downs the
water and pill, while Greta kneels and puts the band-
aids on the backs of her ankles.
DANTE
(looking down at Greta)
I think I'm starting to
UNDERSTAND WHY EVERYONE CALLS

GRETA
Let's leave that coat in my
office for now.

issues.description: Inferences array contains duplicate entries for 'time_of_day' field. First entry correctly identifies 'UNSPECIFIED' with 0.3 confidence and rationale 'No explicit time segment found in scene heading'. Second entry duplicates the field with identical value but contradictory rationale 'AI enrichment supplied unresolved field' and inflated confidence (0.72). This mirrors the exact error pattern from previous QA feedback and violates the instruction to extract unresolved metadata without enrichment.

Provenance array includes entry with method 'ai' for time_of_day field, claiming 'Filled from AI enrichment due to unresolved deterministic value' at 0.72 confidence. This directly contradicts the explicit instruction to extract unresolved fields without enrichment or invention. The scene heading contains '(CONTINUOUS)' with no time indicator, making AI enrichment inappropriate and semantically invalid.

Semantic contradiction in second inference rationale: 'AI enrichment supplied unresolved field' is logically incoherent. If a field is unresolved, it should not be supplied by AI enrichment. The instruction explicitly states to extract unresolved fields, not fill them with AI-generated values.

Overall confidence score (0.677) is inflated given the presence of critical structural errors in inferences and provenance. The confidence should reflect the severity of the duplicate/contradictory entries.

Positive aspects: narrative_beats array is well-constructed with appropriate beat types, descriptions, and confidence scores. Elements array is comprehensive and accurately extracted. Characters_present list is complete. These strengths are overshadowed by the critical errors in metadata handling.

qa_result.summary: Output contains critical structural errors that directly contradict explicit instructions. The inferences and provenance arrays exhibit the exact problematic pattern identified in previous QA feedback: duplicate entries for time_of_day field with contradictory rationales and an inappropriate 'ai' method entry claiming enrichment of an unresolved field.

elements.content: INT. BEL INC. CORRIDOR - RIGHT OF THE PIT (CONTINUOUS)
As they leave her office, we see that Greta is proud
of her position, and it shows. She is aware of
everyone around her and what they are doing -- even
if she doesn't acknowledge it.
GRETA
(pointing at the desk they just left)
I am usually on the top level, but if you don't see me there, don't worry. Leave me a note and I will get back to you as soon as I can.

As they head back down the stairs, Dante and Greta see the SHOE REPAIR GUY, (small, 50-something, nervous looking Italian man), frantically buffing Abe's shoes. No one knows his actual name, nor do they seem to care. Abe is reading the NEWSPAPER and doesn't look up.
ABE
Make sure you have new laces for me tomorrow.
SHOE REPAIR GUY
You got 'er Mr. Hinkley.
Greta gestures towards the Shoe Repair Guy and Abe.
GRETA
You should know that Joaquin insists that everyone has their shoes buffed on Thursdays. In fact, it is company policy. You will see that in 'the book' you receive tomorrow.
Dante smiles. She has never, in her entire life, had anything polished for her.
Abe peers over his newspaper and looks Dante up and down. Dante becomes so flustered that she trips towards Greta. Greta catches her. Abe looks down at his newspaper.
GRETA (CONT'D)
Oopsies! I've got you Dante. It looks like you may need a little more help walking for a bit.

Greta smiles and takes her arm. Dante is flushed with embarrassment as she looks back to Abe. Only, Abe seems to be gone, and we see XANDER, (handsome, shy, 30-something man), just sitting down in his spot.
XANDER
Just what's necessary, please.
SHOE REPAIR GUY
You got it, Mr. Lavery.
As the shoe repair guy shakes his head and gets to work, Xander looks up at Dante 'walking'. Greta is moving her along.

Greta is pointing to an elevator. She is speaking loudly as they are right in front of the pit where brokers are shouting at their various technologies. Each of them is outfitted with a beeper, and each manager is outfitted with a pager and a beeper. We hear these beeping and vibrating randomly constantly.
GRETA
As you are allowed 5-minute smoke breaks, you can take that elevator down to 'P' to the smoking cage.
The cafeteria is on the 30th floor, the mall is on the train level.
(she points to an elevator across from them on the floor below)
Never use this one. This one is for executives only.
Greta gives her a gentle but knowing smile.
DANTE
Ummm...I don't smoke?
GRETA
You will.
They move past the elevator and Greta points to a spot above the pit. It is all mirrored windows, including the door.
GRETA
That is Joaquin's office. You may not be able to see in, but rest assured, if he's in his office, he is always watching. It's best not to disturb him...
(beat)
... ever.
Greta smiles again and takes her towards the pit. She points to the back offices behind it.
GRETA
In those back offices are Tina and Benny. They receive your tickets and take care of it from there.
CROOKED TITS (mousy woman in her 40s), looks up from her desk. Her eyes squint at Dante. She looks unimpressed, purses her lips and looks back down.
Benny, (late 30s, handsome and unassuming), looks up and smiles.
Dante is clinging to Greta's arm for support. Some brokers are starting to turn and are laughing amongst each other. Greta and Dante stop in front of the pit.
GRETA
(claps her hands)
Everyone! Listen up!

We see and hear the muffled sounds of about 30 brokers putting their clients on hold. We see Laynah on the phone with her back to Dante and Greta. She turns around, looks Dante up and down, then turns to resume her phone call. All other eyes are on Dante.
GRETA
This is Dante. This is her first day...
We see that the brokers are a bit confused and looking at each other.
GRETA
(teasingly)
... so, you bad boys be good to her. She is a very, very sweet girl and needs a hearty welcome from all of you.
(she gives a look to a couple of the brokers)
Dante nervously looks around. All is quiet except the muffled voice of Laynah in the background.
The crowd erupts. It is like a Circus of Idiots. Each idiot encouraging the next with some whistling at Dante. One broker starts imitating Dante's walk crudely.
MIKE THE SHIT
Don't worry Dante, I love the handicapped!
Another is bobbing his head up and down between another broker's legs. He is giving him an air blowie.
BROKER
This is how we show our love around here, Dante!
We hear the broker receiving the blowie having a giant orgasm and pounding his chest.
MIKE CHRISTIAN
Yes. YES. YESSSSS!!!! I LOVE YOU DANTE!!!!!!!!!!!!!! YES!!!!!!!!!!!
Another broker is unbuttoning his dress shirt and ripping it open, massaging his chest hair and nipples roughly.
BROKER
Hey Dante! I would love to see a little more of your neckline...I mean, chest line. Fuck it. Your tits!
Greta is just laughing as though they are her children doing a fun skit they made for mom.
GRETA
Oh, you boys.
(to Dante)
They are incredibly incorrigible. But I do love them. And you'll grow to love them too.
(she puts her hands up)
Ok, boys. Settle down.
Dante waits a beat deciding if she should respond to the crowd or not.
DANTE
Hello everyone. I look forward to working with all of you. I'm... I'm ready to learn everything I can.

The room is quiet save for a few brokers piping up to say immature shit like, "shower! shower!", "$100 to you if it sticks!" while a broker is holding up a quarter or flicking their tongues between their 'v' fingers at their mouth.
We are unsure if she is going to speak again. Slowly, she takes off her heels. There's a moment where they wonder if she's going to strip. For once, it quiets everyone.
Laynah peers over.
DANTE
And... you should know that I may not know how to use these for walking ...
(holds up a HIGH HEEL)
but, I certainly know how to use them as a weapon.

Without skipping a beat, Dante swiftly whips it like a throwing star towards the cork board at the opposite wall, hitting a paper perfectly in the center. We see that it is a defaced PICTURE OF CLINTON. The crowd is quiet and then erupts into voracious laughter, whooping and clapping before resuming their phone calls.
Greta turns to Dante and winks.
GRETA
Well played. I think that you will fit in here just fine.

Greta starts walking her to her new desk. Dante is walking steady and confident in her bare feet, one heel in hand. The men are all back on their calls and a couple even turn to Dante with approving nods.
The defaced picture of Clinton falls unceremoniously to the ground.

elements.content: INT. 2ND LEVEL TRADING PIT - DANTE'S DESK
They reach Dante's desk - it is curved, institutional,
and battle-scarred. Laminate top chipped at the edges,
scratched from years of frantic notetaking. Built like a
tank to withstand the daily assault of Wall Street
intensity.
We see YURI, (40-something man with salt-and-pepper hair),
at the desk beside, face down, and one pant leg wet on
the inside.
GRETA
I'll be right back. This will
be your desk. So, please make
yourself comfortable.
Greta swiftly exits and Dante takes a moment to look
around and take in her surroundings. The people, the
office, the din, the chaos. She smiles and places her
new purse on her desk.
Mike the Shit looks up from the desk on the floor
immediately below and pipes up.
MIKE THE SHIT
(into phone)
Holy shit! Everyone is on the
phone right now buying Cisco
up! Let me call my supervisor
OVER TO
pre-approve you for more shares...
Mike hits the hold button and puts the phone to his chest.
MIKE THE SHIT (CONT'D)
Hey Laynah, I thought Abe
told you to leave your dirty
man whores at home? This one
pissed himself!
Laynah, mid-phone dial, peeks out from the other side
of Mike's desk.
LAYNAH
This one is a welcome present
for our 'new broker'.
We see Greta rushing back like a Geisha to her top
client. She has a fresh pair of SLACKS in one hand
and a GLASS OF WATER in another. She is back in an
abnormally fast time.
LAYNAH (CONT'D)
(to Dante)
You may wanna have Greta take
this one to the cleaners
first.
For the first time, Dante sees a slightly unimpressed
look on Greta's face as she ignores Laynah's comment.
Mike and Laynah are back on their phones.
Greta picks up his head, shoves a strange colored pill
in his mouth and force feeds him the water. She has her
back to Dante to try and create some privacy with the
scene.
GRETA
Come now Yuri. Let's get you
cleaned up.
Greta helps him up while he mumbles what sounds
like Russian and starts grabbing at her breasts.
YURI
(in Russian)
Boobies...
Greta turns her head back to Dante for a moment.
GRETA
Tennie will get you set up. I
hope you can excuse me.
DANTE
Of course.
Dante turns back to her desk to see Tennessee. He is
already into her computer typing madly. Things seem to
move incredibly fast around here. He doesn't acknowledge
her.
She looks down at Mike the Shit, who is leaned back in
his chair on the phone, looking at her. He turns back
towards his computer, talking to his client.
In the background, she sees Abe standing by a post. He
has one hand in a slight fist, elegantly placed just
in front of his chest, and the other arm behind him.
The calmness that he exudes is in stark contrast to
the frenzy of the crowd.
He has been watching her, but we have no idea for how
long. He lifts a finger and beckons her over.
DANTE
Excuse me, Tennessee.
TENNESSEE
Tennie. Only my mom calls me
by my full name.
Tennie doesn't look up from the computer screen. Other
than what he said, he seems barely aware of anyone's
presence.
She heads over immediately.
ABE
I'm taking you to lunch Dante.
Seemingly more like a command than a request, Dante
quickly eyes the clock. It is almost 1pm. Abe's gaze
is steady and unreadable.
DANTE
Yes, of course, Abe. Let me
grab my purse.
ABE
That won't be necessary.
He smiles for the first time at her. A smile that is
impossible to read. From behind his back, he produces
her 'throwing star' missing heel as well as her coat
that she left at the bar. Dante sheepishly takes her
items back.
DANTE
(laughing nervously)
No shirt, no shoes, no service?
He turns and glides like an electric eel through the
brokers. Dante quickly follows behind like a lost
duckling, high heels in hand. Without looking behind
him:
ABE
And put your god damn shoes on.
Dante scrambles to put her heels on only to re-commence
her awkward walk. She hears snickering behind her.
They head to the broker elevator this time rather than
the Michaelangelean executive elevator she took with
Cassandra.
Dante slips in and stands beside Abe just as the door
is about to close. He is stoic and refined. She is

DING! The doors close.

Emma is smiling. The scene mirrors exactly what we saw

Would you like an orange juice?
(he eyes his watch)

Dante feels immediately sick. Abe nods to the

I... I would love one.
I always start the day with a
juice. You know, a kick of
vitamin C to keep my immune

(looks her up and down)
I see that you are very
COMFORTABLE WITH YOUR NEW
position.
Emma arrives just in time with what looks like the

Dante. Take it easy. It's
still early.
DANTE
Sorry. I guess I was thirsty.
Uh, maybe I'll just get a

No. You'll get another juice,
but you'll pace yourself.

Yes, sir.

-- Sir? What happened to the
girl earlier this morning who
was spouting off about money,
power, and prestige?
(he laughs)
You didn't even have shoes on
10 minutes ago.
Abe smiles at her.
ABE (CONT'D)
Go ahead and order another.
Dante tries to catch Emma's eye and starts tapping the

TAP TAP TAP TAP!
Emma is at the other end chatting up another customer.
Dante puts her fingers in her mouth and whistles. Abe

That, you shall never do again.

Right. Sorry.
Whilst still holding Dante's hand and gaze, he
elegantly taps his fingers on the bar twice. If you

Abe is training a monkey. Emma starts preparing their

(still gripping her hand)
Let's hear your story.
Dante hiccups and covers her mouth, mortified.

(embarrassed)
Well, breakfast booze is new to me.
Dante shifts in her seat, trying to find a nonchalant

Let's hear the parts of your
STORY THAT AREN'T GLARINGLY
OBVIOUS.

Wait. Let me guess.

He continues to study her up and down slowly. Taking

He takes all of her in before leaning forward. In

yes... Lysol. Dumpy-ass motel scent.

yes --

-- Cassandra popped your Saks
cherry.

OUT OF YOU.

elements.content: INT. GEMINI'S BAR VIP ROOM - LATER

Dante and Abe are deep in conversation in a private VIP room booth. Abe's scotch glass is half-empty and Dante's scotch glass is full. Dante is visibly drunk, and she is eating the last of the pretzels in a bowl right in front of her.
DANTE
--that's why I work as hard as I do. Let's just say I learned early that no one was gonna hand me anything. I will never go back...
EXCUSE ME --
(crying)
-- Sorry, I don't usually...
Abe passes her a napkin off the table. She dabs below her eyes, somewhat missing part of the make-up in her state.
DANTE
Shit. I hate talking about my family.
(studying him intensely)
I never talk about this stuff.
Dante looks to Abe as he nods politely. He seems like a different person than before - soft, kind, heartfelt even.
Dante dabs below her eyes again and blows her nose with the napkin. She takes a deep breath and collects herself.
DANTE
Can I tell you something Abe?
ABE
Sure thing.
Dante leans in.
DANTE
I have never worn heels in my entire life.
(beat)
Shhhhhhhh...
Abe takes a moment to look at her incredulously.
ABE
OH. OH.
(patting himself down)
Give me a moment here to find my surprise face.

They have a laugh together and we see Dante clearly relieved at the lightness she has found with Abe. We see the bartender bringing over new DRINKS plus 2 SHOTS. She sets them on the table and cleans the empties off.
DANTE
Ugh. I'm sick of talking about my life.
(studying Abe's face)
How did you really know about my past?
Abe takes a moment to consider his response. He takes a large sip of his drink and downs his shot. Dante downs her shot as well.
ABE
I have a knack. I can read people. I used to think everybody could do it.
DANTE
Yah. No.
ABE
I learned that during my first fist fight in grade 7. I was small for my age, so when I entered junior high, the taller boys started to pick on me.
(beat)

There was one gang, The Bloodgang, not very original I know, that was... particularly intimidating. One day, the leader, Civatrelli, and his 4 thug friends gathered around me in a circle. To further the cliché, they wanted my lunch money. Civatrelli was punching my shoulder to weaken my will.
(beat)
I don't know how else to explain this, but suddenly, all I saw was... truth. It was almost as though I could see a life map inside of him.
(beat)
I went on to tell him about
ABE (CONT'D)
his whore mother, who cheated on his father, with his best friend. And, when he was left home alone with his uncle, while his mom was off whoring, his uncle was diddling him in his bed.
(beat)
The shock on their faces was my first indication that there was something unique about what I could see. I don't know if I just read people well or if it is some extra-sensory gift.
DANTE
So, what happened?
ABE
Oh... I had the living SHIT beat out of me. And they took my lunch money.
He laughs, with Dante following suit.
ABE (CONT'D)
But they never came near me again.

I admired their power and audacity. How they just took whatever they wanted. I studied them for the rest of the year, spying on their bullying. Eventually, I became a part of their group... their secret weapon, if you will.
DANTE
So, this is your secret to your success?
ABE
I would say that is part of it, yes. I learned a lot about the power of knowing the truth that day. And learning how to get what you want.
As Dante takes this in, she looks around the bar. It is starting to fill. Her eyes settle on a 30-something, incredibly handsome male at the end of the bar. Abe turns to study him intensely.
ABE (CONT'D)
Mmm. Wanna-be. Bullshit bar stool philosopher. I'd say a... substitute teacher. Hoping to be noticed by a higher up in our business to make the amount of money he tells the ladies he makes.
(beat)
Player. Has had an ugly girlfriend since high school who pays for his life. She thinks he is volunteering at the high school right now.
Dante looks around and settles on a very well-dressed woman sitting at a booth with an older gentleman.
ABE (CONT'D)

Ah yes. My guess would be a high-end escort. Daddy ran off with a younger woman when she was just a child. Mother raised her and her 5 siblings alone on a cashier's wage. She got into the biz to help her family.
Dante looks impressed.
DANTE
You are a fascinating man.
(beat)
Thank you so much for hiring me. It's truly such an honour to be --
ABE
-- you don't actually think you are hired do you?
Dante is laughing while Abe's face darkens.
ABE (CONT'D)
We don't just take any Spic with a rack off the street and make them richer than a Colombian fucking drug lord!
(laughs)
There is a process, Dante.
(beat)

So here is the way it works. If you make it through the night --and please take this all in at once, because I hate repeating myself-- I expect you to get to work early. If you are late, you may get cut. Period.
Also, if you have any complaints, keep them to yourself. Usually, we are too busy to give a fuck, and if it is important enough, you will remember it when we aren't busy.
(beat)
Which never happens. My suggestion is to run it past Greta. She has been around long enough to let you know if you are complaining about something petty, or if you have a verifiable issue.

Next, be yourself. Don't try to be like anyone else in this firm. If I wanted a fucking clone, I would've gone to the Roslin Institute. But, if you do want to emulate someone, then continue to follow Cassandra. That woman knows how to make money.
(beat)
Oh, and never ask me a question twice. If I don't answer it the first time, it's because I have no intention of answering.
He sits back in his chair slowly and takes a deep breath. He tips back the rest of his scotch. His hand goes up to the approaching bartender in a 'stop' gesture.
After an uncomfortably long beat:
ABE (CONT'D)
You need two giant balls to work here, Dante. Do you have two giant balls?
Dante is speechless and cannot get a beat on him.
ABE (CONT'D)
DO YOU? DO YOU HAVE TWO GIANT BALLS?
DANTE
Yes. Yes, I do.
Abe takes a moment to look at her.
ABE
No. No you don't. You're a woman. You have a little flower vagina. I have two giant balls. Two giant balls made of pure gold.
Abe is grabbing his testicles firmly.
ABE (CONT'D)
Do you want to see them?
Abe is shaking his testicles up and down. He drops them and leans forward.
ABE (CONT'D)
And let me tell you something. That SHIT you pulled during your interview this morning...
(intensifying)
in your CHEAP HOOKER outfit...
Abe is now poking her shoulder, harder and harder. Dante grabs the side of the table to steady herself. His eyes are blazing and intense as lasers.
ABE (CONT'D)
... is never, EVER going to happen again. Do you hear me?
(shouting)
I AM RICH. I AM POWERFUL. AND NO ONE, AND I MEAN NO ONE, FUCKS WITH ME.

Dante is frozen in terror. Abe is sweating. He sits back and calms himself. He takes a small POCKET SQUARE from his suit pocket and serenely wipes his upper lip. We see some brokers quickly glance over.
ABE (CONT'D)
The only reason you are sitting here today is because of the power of Cassandra's pussy. That pussy's got fangs.
Abe takes a large breath.
ABE (CONT'D)
Now, I am going to tell you something that is going to stay between you and me.
Abe leans in. Dante can barely find her voice. Dante leans in cautiously.
DANTE
Of course.
ABE
This is very serious Dante.
Abe leans in further and lowers his voice.
ABE (CONT'D)
One of the men, here tonight...
(beat)
... has... one nut.
DANTE
Sorry?
Abe appears exasperated.
ABE
Nut, Dante. NUT.
Ball. Fuck orb. Ass slapper. Tea bag. TESTICLE.
Abe sits back smugly and smiles. He is quite visibly drunk.
DANTE
One... nut. Okay. One nut. Alright.

The doors fly open to the private room and in walk a steady stream BROKERS. CIGARETTES hanging out of their mouths. We see them smirking at Dante and heading to an adjacent booth. She looks at the front of everyone's pants and quickly looks away.
Abe leans forward.
ABE
(quietly)

Here are the rules: You have the rest of tonight to find out who our nutless Joe is. Without divulging our secret, of course. If you are correct in identifying this ball-less wonder, you can start your training. If you are incorrect, Dante, it's back to your ship-wrecked whore momma to scrub toilets on the Upper East Side. Or any of the other fuck shit welfare slave jobs from your Dominican sob story.
(beat)
You can let me know who it is. 7am tomorrow morning.
(looks at his phone, lights blinking with messages waiting)
Now, I've wasted enough time here and have a lot of work to get back to. I leave you with the Band of Idiots.
With that, Abe stands up to make an announcement.
ABE (CONT'D)
WELL. EVERYONE!
The motley mob miraculously quiets and looks up towards him. He is truly commandeering.
ABE (CONT'D)
IT'S BEEN A SLICE, BUT IT IS TIME FOR THIS OLE PENCIL-NECKED PRICK TO LEAVE.
Abe ends his announcement looking at Dante and smiling. Abe wags his finger at Dante for all to see.
He suddenly seems stone sober.
ABE (CONT'D)
Remember what I told you Dante -- unless you want to join madre...
He puts his fingers up to his lips.
ABE (CONT'D)
...SHHHHHHHHHH.
(beat)
Have at 'er boys. This one was nursed on Coors Light, so no need to break the bank.
Abe leaves through the VIP room doors.

Flickers through the swinging doors reveal Abe with the 'teacher' and 'high end hooker' from his psychic reading hours earlier. They're greeting him like old friends. Dante's laugh is bitter - she realizes she's been conned.
DANTE
(to the brokers)
I need... I need to use the washroom. Excuse me.

elements.content: INT. GEMINIS WASHROOM
Dante stares at her blurry reflection in the mirror. A
silent pep talk seems to be taking place as she glances
toward the door - weighing her escape. She looks back at
the mirror, studying her drunken reflection for a few
beats. Stay or go?
Her expression shifts - from uncertainty to something
deeper. Whatever she's thinking about, it's bigger than
this moment. Her jaw sets with quiet determination. Two
years. She only needs two years.
She takes her pulse at her wrist - elevated. Pulls down
her lower lip in the mirror, checking circulation.
Knowing she has a narrow window before full absorption,
she kneels by the toilet and forces herself to vomit.
Back at the sink, she turns on the tap and drinks heavily
from her cupped hands, rehydrating. She pulls a granola
bar from her purse and devours it to slow any remaining
alcohol absorption.
She takes a deep breath, straightens her shoulders, and
heads back out.

elements.content: INT. PRIVATE VIP ROOM - GIANT BOOTH - 5PM

Dante is sandwiched in the middle of a semi-circle in the booth between Dunaway (sweet, shy, geeky broker in his 20s) Mike the Shit, Mike Christian (tall, sweet, even-tempered broker in his 30s) and Yuri (who looks as though he has seen better days). There are many, many SHOOTERS on the table, all still full. In fact, every inch is filled. In this sea of shooters, we see 4 FLUTE GLASSES.

Can we pop this for you?
The boys snicker.

PUSSIES! Yuri would have a better chance of opening it than you two faggots.

Whoa. Whoa. Wait.

What was that secret all about? Hey, Dante?

MIKE CHRISTIAN
Yah, good point Mike.

No secrets in this firm. Not wise to get off to a bad start with us. We're your allies.

Management will just use you to get what they want. We are the ones who support each other. And since Abe isn't exactly an open book, we need to know any grain of information that he may divulge. Now, 'fess up.
They are all nodding. Yuri nods with a delay.

Were you just staring at Mike's crotch?
MIKE CHRISTIAN
No secrets between us, right?
(beat)
9 inches.

DANTE
Sooo, how long you guys been at the firm?
MIKE THE SHIT
Don't try and change the subject. How about we play a little drinking game, winner gets the secret? A little, 'who here owns... ?' game?

Who here owns a Porsche?

If you don't, you have to drink.

Ok, wait, wait. This isn't fair. I just started here...
MIKE THE SHIT
It's the rules. We all play by the rules. Don't we guys?

MIKE THE SHIT
Next question. Who here owns a mansion in The Hamptons.
(to Dante)
Do you? Drink up.
The guys are laughing and drinking their champagne. As Dante reaches for a shot -

elements.content: INT. PRIVATE VIP ROOM - DOORWAY

BAM! The deep brown leather, brass-trimmed, saloon-style doors to the room fly open. Joaquin enters quickly, 1 GIANT MOTOROLA CELL PHONE in each hand, one to his ear, one on his chest. He has a cigar hanging out of his mouth, plumes of smoke billowing upwards.
JOAQUIN
(into phone, very loud)
...you want what? Hold on... I'm on an important call.
He puts that phone to his chest and takes the other one to his ear.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
(into phone)
Ok. 3 pairs of Valentino custom made. Have 'em here by next week. And don't you dare send me that ass hide you tried selling me last week. Alright... bye-bye.
He hangs that phone up and takes the one on his chest up to his ear.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
Tamara... honey. What's wrong with your Maserati? Don't you have homework? Go make yourself a stiff drink until the craving passes.
He hangs up and loudly bangs both phones on the bar like setting his rifles down at the end of the day.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
Chewie!
We can see that Kensington loves his humor and equally loves to sass him back.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
(pointing to the TVs above the bar playing the news)
Turn that shit up!
KENSINGTON
(while grabbing the remote)
Fuck you, Joaquin.
Joaquin looks towards the booth, impressed that she just said 'fuck you' to him.
We see the brokers in the booth laughing.
He extends his arms to their furthest length on the bar wood while still looking at the booth.
JOAQUIN
I want this many shots! Make them from the House of Cognac..
Joaquin is still looking at the booth, especially Dante, eyes twinkling.
Kensington starts setting up SHOT GLASSES between his hands. His hands don't move.
Everyone at the booth leans back, laughing.
DUNAWAY
Herrrrrre comes The Joaquin Show. Brace yourself Dante.
The group is laughing and nodding as they all nurse a shot.
JOAQUIN
Hey... HEY! Make 'em tight as your arse, Blanche.
Dante watches as Kensington fills every square inch of space between his outstretched arms with shooters. We also notice that she is pouring from the LOUIS XIII CRYSTAL BOTTLE, $10,000/bottle.
Mike Christian nods his head towards Mike the Shit.
MIKE CHRISTIAN
Just be happy Mike's not ordering the shots.
Mike the Shit gives him a long-armed punch from across the table. To Dante:
MIKE CHRISTIAN (CONT'D)
See what I mean?

Joaquin lumbers over with 2 shots in each hand, fingers in the shot glasses and giant phones under his armpits. The humor in his walk is only exacerbated by the bulky pager and beeper hanging off his belt loops.
In the b.g. Kensington is loading the rest of the shots; a double-decker tray.
JOAQUIN
Holy shit, what a motley crew! Make some room for some high quality.

He seems to be referring to himself and his shooters as he pushes his way into the sardine booth, facing the TVs. He passes Dante the two shots in his right hand. While licking the booze off his fat finger and thumb:
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
(to Dante)
OHHHHHHH STATE! You look a fright!
(looks at her again)
So, how's it goin', Fancypants?
He looks over at Yuri, who has been quiet up to this point. Joaquin flamboyantly jumps back in feigned fright.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
Jesus! You got a face on you like a bag 'o smashed assholes! What's the matter YURINE, wet undies givin' you a rash?
Yuri smiles with a delay and gives a thumbs up.
YURI
(in Russian)
Good!
Everyone is laughing. This man has a joke a second, not that you can understand them.
JOAQUIN
Holy shit. We better git some medicine in ya.
Kensington arrives and places all the shots Joaquin just bought on the adjacent two-top.
KENSINGTON
Startin' out slow, are we?
Joaquin is beckoning to Kensington to bring him a couple of shots from his stash.
JOAQUIN
(pointing at Kensington and then Yuri)
Get me one for Yee, and one for Pee.
The group snickers. Joaquin hands it to Yuri and looks to Dante and Kensington for a cheers.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
Down the hatch.
Joaquin gives a little look to the group, and they all grab a shot from the table. The group shoots them back. Yuri, with a delay, shoots his back also.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
Holy shit, if I wanted to have tea with the queen, I woulda went to Buckingham fucking palace. Come on, miss, let's go.

He pushes her second shot towards her brashly. She has a mini dry heave when she takes the shot and the group snickers. They all join her for a second shot. Joaquin just grabs a random from the table.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
(makes a face)
Gasoline!
Joaquin is rubbing the chest hair spewing out of his opened dress shirt top, tie in his breast pocket. He seems to be studying her while continuing to rub his chest hair.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
So, who made you? Two mutts?
Dante has no idea what he is talking about, and it shows.
MIKE CHRISTIAN
He means, who are your parents?
Joaquin loves when someone understands what he is saying. With a wink and a head jerk, to Mike C.:
JOAQUIN
Spot on, buddy.
MIKE CHRISTIAN
Don't worry, he doesn't always talk like this. His Newfie always comes out when he drinks... or when it's showtime.
JOAQUIN
It's NEWFOUNDLANDER to you, my son...
The group laughs. Joaquin looks back at Dante, awaiting her response.
DANTE
My mom is Haitian, and my dad is Puerto... wait, no... other way around... ?
Dante is laughing. She is too drunk to remember her parents' heritage. Joaquin is shaking his head again.
JOAQUIN
Holy shit, she's not gonna last a minute. Maybe you need a shot of PENIS-CILLIN?
He grabs his package (he likes to do this). The group is killing themselves laughing. Dante eyes seem to linger a bit too long on him grabbing his package as she attempts a quick testicle count.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
Ahhh, you like that? Well, there is a lot more where that came from.
The group is still laughing. He drops his package and looks at the group as though he didn't just do anything raunchy.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
So, what's the word boys?
MIKE THE SHIT
Well, Dante here has a secret that Abe told her. She won't divulge.
JOAQUIN
No secrets here, Dante. Rule #1.

Laynah walks up beside Joaquin. She has changed her shirt so that her fake boobs are bursting out the impossibly small bodice she's stretched over them. She has clearly re-done her make-up, hair, and outfit. She is smiling through her fire engine red lipstick -- which is all over her front teeth.
LAYNAH
What's going on, boys?
As we see Dante take a sigh of relief, Joaquin turns his head right into her cleavage.
JOAQUIN
Holy shit! Ma? Ma? Is that you, MA?
He is nose deep into her cleavage and is grabbing at her breasts, as though trying to recognize them. She slaps his hands away.
LAYNAH
Screw you, Joaquin. Move over.
She barely fits herself at the end of the booth.
Dante looks to her and rubs her front teeth as though to tell her there is lipstick on her teeth -- girl code, and as an olive branch. She needs someone on her side here.
Laynah, as usual, doesn't understand, and pretends to rub her front teeth right back, as though mocking Dante's actions. Although, she doesn't quite touch her teeth, so they stay stained.
Joaquin leans over to Dante and whispers. Well, ok, he speaks loud enough for everyone to hear.
JOAQUIN
Stunned as mi arse.
Laynah hits Joaquin. He laughs.

Cassandra walks through the saloon doors, just hanging up her phone. This seems to be a much looser Cassandra than Dante from earlier as she is, yes, dancing her way towards the bar. She is quite drunk.
She stops short of the bar and throws her arms up.
CASSANDRA
This night's on MEEEEE! WE GOT CANE DEEDS!
She is pointing towards Yuri.
CASSANDRA (CONT'D)
That's right my friend, we did it!
Yuri smiles and gives another thumbs up. It looks like he has been up for days to help close this deal. We see the guys around him congratulating him.
CASSANDRA (CONT'D)
Your best tequila all around, Kensy!
(beat, pointing to the TVs)
Turn that shit down, and the music UP!
We see Kensington turning down the TVs and turning up the stereo. We notice that she has turned on the TV subtitles.
The group starts clapping and whooping.
JOAQUIN
(leaning into Dante)
Don't think we are done with you.
He puts his hand on her leg and holds it there a bit too long.
As Cassandra dances over, we see everyone reaching for a shot for cheers.
The music is loud, and the party has officially started. CLINK!

elements.content: INT. GEMINI'S PRIVATE VIP ROOM - LATER

There is loud club music (something like Gypsy Kings - Bamboleo) and flashes of VERY DRUNK QUICK CLIPS between black transitions. We hear some dialogue here and there. Things like, 'you wanna see the real thing?' when she is caught looking at someone's package. 'What's the secret?' 'What did Abe tell you?' 'DANTE! WHAT IS THE FUCKING SECRET?!'

Here we also see Paul and SMITH who is the co-owner of the bar, and twin brother of Kensington. He is in his early 30s, handsome (almost pretty), and sweet looking. Kensington introduces him to Dante. Dunaway and Smith are laughing together.

Cassandra is on the bar table singing, Dante and others are dancing, shooters are being tipped back, there is lots of drinking, lots of drugs, blow off hookers, gambling at the tables, men reaching for their giant money wads, brokers making out with women, Laynah giving a blowjob to a broker in a booth, and some have their arms around each other and are singing loudly. We really see the brotherhood, men demeaning women, and the excessiveness in this scene.
Everyone, including Dante, seems to be having the time of their life.
We also see scenes of Cassandra telling her to 'straighten up/hold yourself together' while snorting coke from her giant, SILVER RING.
END OF ACT THREE
ACT FOUR

elements.content: INT. GEMINIS - MEN'S WASHROOM
As they enter, we see PAUL, in front of the urinal,
just zipping up his pants under his giant gut. He
looks from Joaquin to Dante to Joaquin's 'get the fuck
out of here' face.
He exits very quickly without a word.
SHUNNNNNNNNNNNP. Joaquin drags the GARBAGE CAN in
front of the door.
He reaches into his pocket and takes out a rather
LARGE BAG of WHITE POWDER and a STRAW. He proceeds to
create a line on the side of the sink with his one of
his BLACK VISA CREDIT CARDS (we see him choosing).
JOAQUIN
You need to straighten up.
(passing her the straw)
Here.
Dante has never done drugs in her life. Drinking,
yes. Drugs, no.
She is drunk. She is disinhibited. She grabs the straw
and shakily places it at the start of the line. We hear a
big SNIIIIIFFFFFFFF as the white powder slowly
disappears.
As Dante's head comes up, we see that she has a fair
amount under her nose, and she is choking.
DANTE
It musta went down the wrong tube--
Joaquin face reflects his disdain, and he hands
her his pocket napkin.
JOAQUIN
-- Jesus. Wipe that shit up
NEWBIE BEFORE SOMEONE LICKS
it from yer nose. This is
SOME VELVETY SHIT. DON'T
waste it.
He takes a small, what looks like a BRASS LOCKET, out
of his other pocket. There is a small, BRASS STRAW on
top. He takes a different baggie of white powder out
of the other pocket and makes a fat line.
As his head comes up, we see his face and eyes are
blazing red. He is a whole different, and scarier,
person than earlier.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
ENOUGH'S ENOUGH. I'M GIVING
you 3 choices: you either
tell me Abe's secret, I fire
you... or (beat) you blow me.
Right now, Spic.
Dante wildly stares at Joaquin.
After a long beat, she walks towards him slowly,
seductively. As she approaches, she lays her hand on
his giant gut. He looks at her, sweating like a pig.
Her hand slowly trails down his King Henry VIII mound,
towards his groin. She undoes his zipper. Her hand
slips in. He is smiling and his head tilts back.
She grabs his testicles hard. So much so that we see
his body slightly raise on the wall. He is wincing in
pain. All men watching the show should be saying,
Mama, along with him.
DANTE
(whispering into his ear)
Do you want to keep both of
these, or shall I bring one
to Abe, as bounty, and create
my own destiny?
Joaquin is shaking his head yes, then no, then...
whatever he is trying to convey, it clearly means, LET
GO. She lets go of his testicles and we see him
slightly drop to the floor. Lower than before as he
is hunching in pain and somewhat winded.
JOAQUIN
(breathlessly)
Bitch.
Dante exits the washroom.

elements.content: INT. GEMINI'S BAR - 8:45PM - CONTINUOUS
Dante is coming out of the bathroom, sweating.
Xander walks straight up beside her, sipping a CLEAR DRINK with a bobbing LIME. He says nothing to her, as they watch the drunk insanity in front of them, together.
Dante looks to him and sees that he is watching Dunaway tuck into a SALAD. Her eyes follow to Dunaway eating.
XANDER
You know, ever since Dunaway had the testicular cancer, he's become a real pain in the ass health nut.
(beat)
He's even doing yoga.
Xander hands her his drink.
XANDER (CONT'D)
Here, water. You have to balance this.
Dante gratefully takes the water and downs it.
XANDER (CONT'D)
Have you even eaten today?
Before she can respond, Joaquin storms out of the washroom, red faced, sweaty, and freshly coked up. He is walking a bit funny.
DANTE
(to self)
Uh-oh...
JOAQUIN
(enraged and shouting)
I think it's time that our new little piggy takes herself alllllll the way home.
Joaquin is at the bar exit pointing at Dante and motioning her towards the door. He is adjusting himself in his pants.

The crowd that is close enough to hear starts laughing and oinking, before going back to their shenanigans. Dante looks around and no one seems to be helping her except Xander, who cocks his head towards the door.
XANDER
Go.
Dante exits quickly.

elements.content: EXT. SIDEWALK IN FRONT OF TAXI
Joaquin is behind Dante, marching her out. He immediately waves a CAB down and opens a door for her.
JOAQUIN
Get in.

As Dante heads towards the cab, we see that walking has suddenly become very difficult. He grabs her arm and roughly sits her in the cab, closes the door and walks around to the CABBIE'S window. He pulls his THICK MONEY CLIP out, full of HUNDREDS.
JOAQUIN (CONT'D)
Take this ditch pig home.
The cabbie (ARMAN) is a well-manicured, AFGHAN MALE in his 40s. Joaquin slips the cabbie $100.
ARMAN
(with a Farsi accent)
Yes, sir.
Arman starts asking Dante where to go, we see Joaquin moving back around the cab with a strange smile slowly curling across his face.
He pats the back of the cab a couple of times to send it off.
BAM! BAM!

elements.content: INT. CAB - 9PM - CONTINUOUS
Fade in from black. It is quiet. Only the motor of the cab is heard.
We see Dante wilting in the back, head in hands.
DANTE
(to self)
Fuck. Fuck. Fucka. Fucka. Fucka. Fuck.
Dante slumps against the cab window, eyes glassy. The city streaks past - grey apartments, neon liquor signs, faceless corner stores - smearing together like wet paint. All she wants is to disappear.
Arman stops in front of her building.
ARMAN
That will be $20.
Dante takes a minute to look at him in the rear-view mirror. She is blinking slowly and speaking in slurs.
DANTE
NICE TRY.
(peering at his tag on the dash)
What's your name?
ARMAN
My name is Arman, Miss.
DANTE
Is this fucking joke, Ar-mee?
ARMAN
Sorry?
DANTE
I get your opportunity eye, but you been paid.
ARMAN
No, Miss. Nobody paid me.
Dante takes a moment, looking at him.
DANTE
THIS ISN'T FUCKING PAKISTAN, AR-MEE.
(beat)
I know these tricks. Don't fuck with me.
ARMAN
(laughing)
OKAY.
(beat)
Can I ask, are you okay?
DANTE
No. I'm not fucking okay. I'm fucked.
ARMAN
Miss, can I say?
DANTE
Am I home now?
ARMAN
Where I come from, a man would never let a woman come home alone like this. Always, you should have a good man with you.
DANTE
(laughing)
R-man... where I come from, this is what a good man does.
He gets out to open her door.
DANTE
NO! I'll do it.
Arman just shakes his head as she smiles and flips him a slow bird.

She exits the cab on her own (with great difficulty) and heads to the front door of a brownstone building with her middle finger still extended. Her heels are in her hand again and her legs seem to be working less and less.
Arman watches her with concern until she enters the building.

elements.content: INT. APARTMENT BUILDING, CORRIDOR IN FRONT OF APT. DOOR. - JUST PAST 9PM

Dante is in front of an apartment door rustling for her keys in her purse. She pulls the keys back and looks at all of them. She notices a new KEY CHAIN. It is two, golden testicles with a mini plaque saying 'He Who Owns the Gold Rules'. She has a brief memory of Abe giving her these telling her she 'needs a pair'.
Dante looks up to take the moment in and smiles.
When she finally finds her key, she keeps trying the lock and missing while longer transition scenes of black are occurring.
When she finally gets the key part of the way in, it doesn't seem to fit.
FADE TO BLACK.
We hear a 'bang' and a 'thump' in the dark...
FADE IN:
Dante is lying on her side with her eyes wide open. One eye is quickly swelling. She is looking upward. A trickle of blood starts trailing down her lips from her nose.
FADE TO BLACK.
